alert.note: Alert for Juniata; Montour; Northumberland; Snyder; Union (Pennsylvania) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 27 at 1:14PM EDT by NWS State College
info.description: ...A STRONG THUNDERSTORM WILL IMPACT WESTERN NORTHUMBERLAND... NORTHEASTERN JUNIATA...EASTERN SNYDER...WEST CENTRAL MONTOUR AND EASTERN UNION COUNTIES THROUGH 145 PM EDT... At 114 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 11 miles southwest of Selinsgrove, moving north at 45 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts of 50 to 55 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. This strong thunderstorm will be near... Paxtonville around 120 PM EDT. Kreamer and Middleburg around 125 PM EDT. Selinsgrove, Kratzerville and Hummels Wharf around 130 PM EDT. Sunbury, Winfield and Shamokin Dam around 135 PM EDT. Lewisburg, Northumberland and Montandon around 140 PM EDT. Milton, New Columbia and Mooresburg around 145 PM EDT. Other locations impacted by this storm include New Berlin, West Milton, Freeburg, McEwensville and Dalmatia. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...55 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 700 PM EDT for south central Pennsylvania.
